newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Wild NZ dlr ends touch firmer, seen consolidating.
newsitem.headline: Wild NZ dlr ends touch firmer, seen consolidating.

text.p: The New Zealand dollar ended Wednesday's session a touch firmer, after trading a wide US$0.6467-6505 range, and dealers said it looked set for a period of consolidation after its recent dramatic falls.
The Kiwi closed at US$0.6494/01 and at 64.41 on its Trade-Weighted Index, up from 0.6484/91 and 64.27 at the open.
"Effectively we were probing the upside to start the day," said a dealer.
"New York had seen a high, we retested it and set a high at 0.6505. After that Aussie came off and Kiwi is still attracting sellers on the rallies."
The Australian dollar dipped after benign inflation data.
"We've seen some Asian interest to buy since then and a little bit of corporate New Zealand buying and Aussie's coming back a bit as well," the dealer said.
With resistance pegged around 0.6500/20, the Kiwi was seen in a 0.6450-6520 range for the time being. "I think we will consolidate for a little while," said another dealer.
